commitResults.messageTitle: Level 2. Add, List: added storing and display functionality, edited formatting for prints for aesthetic purposes
Level 3. Mark as Done: Added marking and unmarking function for tasks
Level 4. ToDos, Events, Deadlines: Refactored code for Task to apply polymorphism and added TaskManager class for more encapsulation
Handle Errors: Created 3 new exception classes, handled 5 different error types
Level 6. Delete: added functionality for deleting tasks from list. Handled potential errors arising from deletion
Automated Text UI Testing: Removed unexpected blank spaces from prints, wrote test cases in input.txt and output in EXPECTED.TXT
Added more test cases to check for invalid input
Minor patch to delete function, added remaining tasks to prints

commitResults.messageBody:
Current classes are not in packages.
Adding classes into packages facilitate further developments in an OOP
manner, while ensuring that we improve encapsulation and abstraction.

Previously, the TaskManager class was used to parse and process commands.
As this does not optimally use the OOP paradigm, much of the code was
refactored to allow for the use of polymorphism and encapsulation.

This would allow the project to be more scalable for future increments.

Previously, a direct switch was used for tasks.
For a better typed set up, enums are used for the commands instead.

Previously, the project was only able to write and modify tasks in
the existing working list. To allow for users to save the task list,
the save function was introduced.

Previously, the event and deadline tasks represented dates with Strings.
To allow for more flexible use of the dates, dates were changed to
LocalDate objects instead

Previously, save command could only save for viewing in text file.
To allow for automatic saving and loading, text storage and text
loader was created.

Added a new InvalidOperationException for when program tries to
run mark on an existing marked task, and unmark on an unmarked
task.

Refactored exceptions such that most exceptions caught in execute
commands are caught in Command Manager instead.

Previously, other packages were on the same level as duke.
Currently, other packages are placed in duke as well.

Previously, testing was only done using input and output comparison
via text-ui-test and manual regression test.

To test components such as Task objects and the UiManager object,
component tests were written for methods in these classes. Impure
methods are not tested by the component tests siince they are
tested by text-ui-test.

Previously, there was no find function to search for tasks using
keywords. This patch will add the find function and print a
formatted list containing all tasks with the keyword. Text-ui-test
is also updated to test the functionality of the feature.

Previously, no JavaDoc comments were used. To facilitate better
understanding of each method and class for documentation purposes,
JavaDoc comments are added to document all public methods and
classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Style code according to Coding Standard
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, code was not styled fully to Coding Standard.
Edits are made such that code adheres to Coding Standard.
